auctionWorks.details: Studying Experience Design (BDes Hons) at University of Dundee

auctionWorks.name: Daria Naidonova
auctionWorks.details: Studying Experience Design (BDes Hons) at University of Dundee

schedule.description:
Door open for General Registration - game jam participants and experience ticket.

Tea, Coffee and Pastries served in Tatha Canteen, Upper Foyer.
Welcome from Rose, opening remarks from Chira and Maria. Announcements in the Juniper Auditorium.

Talk schedule begins in Robertson and Weston Learning Studios.

Game Jam continues in Juniper Auditorium. Coaches will support participants.

Judges can walk around and chat to participants.
Lunch is served in Tatha Canteen, Upper Foyer.

Talk schedule continues in Robertson and Weston Learning Studio.

Game Jam continues in Juniper Auditorium.

Judges can walk around and chat to participants.

Tea, coffee and snacks served in Tatha Canteen, Upper Foyer.

Judging panel gather in Robertson and Weston Learning Studio for presentations. Participants test technical set up.

All teams present across two different rooms.

Robertson Learning Studio - Internal Challenge play back.

Weston Learning Studio - external Challenge playback.

Winners announced and prizes presented by Rose Ulldemolins in Juniper Auditorium.

Closing remarks from Amit from a Tech perspective and Lee from Design point of view.
Networking drinks in Tatha Canteen, Upper Foyer.

Event concludes.

Exhibits and Speakers pack up.

Venue closes.

talks.title: (Fun)ctionality
talks.description: How the tools, technologies and techniques from the world of video games can change the way you can design - for joy!

talks.title: From Fitness Plans to Function Calls: A Journey into Coding Thanks to the Dundee Tech School
talks.description: A look into the journey of the Dundee Tech School through Toby, one of the graduates of the first Dundee Tech School cohort. He will look into where he started before his role in tech and what he has gone on to achieve up to now.

talks.title: 25 Years of GameMaker
talks.description: Join Russell Kay for a brief overview of his journey, the evolution of GameMaker, and its 25-year journey. Discover the milestones and innovations that have shaped this influential game development tool.

talks.title: Games Industry Panel
talks.description: A mixture of internal and external people who didn't follow a typical 'games career path' but entered the industry with other skills or use those skills elsewhere.

talks.title: Evolution of Engagement
talks.description: A break from all the talks

talks.title: Design as a mode of inquiry at Studio Ordinary
talks.description: This talk will focus on the value of participatory co-design and how design can be leveraged as a mode of inquiry to change conversations about disability, using examples of collaborative work from Studio Ordinary

talks.title: The future of Scottish Widows app
talks.description: How we're transforming the way the UK saves for the future, levelling up with gamification, and delivering industry changing experiences

talks.title: Investment from Eye Catching Ambition
talks.description: A look into the journey behind their project Red Rampant, and the lessons they've learned along the way - the pitfalls and pick-me-ups of starting a company, building a team, taking chances, and growing their game. Then, building to the story of how they secured investment, how they're using the funds, and what the future holds.

talks.title: M365 CoPilot: The Art of the Prompt
talks.description: In this session, we will explore what makes a good prompt when using Copilot. What are the elements you need to think about to get the most out of GenAI and the importance of remembering to say please!

talks.title: Exploring Gamification in Academia
talks.description: This talk will examine the academic study of gamification, highlighting its potential benefits and limitations. We'll explore how academic research allows for critical examination of the 'dark side' of gamification and discuss how skills developed in this setting can be applied to industry development and research.

talks.title: Stick to the Script: Building coherent narratives in open world spaces
talks.description: The story at any pace and in any order. How do game writers craft a satisfying plot for every player, regardless of their play style, and what can we learn about this from financial service journey design?

talks.title: FinTech Innovation and Gamification
talks.description: This session will showcase innovative gamification in the UK FinTech industry, highlight the Innovation team's experiments with Peek & Poke to achieve better customer engagement an conclude with a Q & A session.

talks.title: Go Fish!
talks.description: Getting over your fear of failure and finding inspiration to create in unlikely places.

jammers.welcomeDescription: Here are some details of what to expect on the day. We can't wait to see what you create!
jammers.challengeDescription: Your team will create a game based on a theme that will be announced at the start of the game jam. You can use any tools or technology you like.
jammers.challengeInternal: Make learning about what Scottish Widows offers engaging and interactive by using games or gamification to captivate the right generation at the right time.
jammers.challengeInternalDescriptor: On the 3rd March you'll be randomly given one of the following topics:
jammers.internalTopics:
â€¢ Investments
 â€¢ Budgeting
 â€¢ Protection
 â€¢ General Insurance
 â€¢ Building Your Pension 
 â€¢ Accessing your Pension
jammers.challengeExternal: Make a 'Game for Good' to help tackle something that matters to you. Choose from :
jammers.externalTopics:
â€¢ Social Justice, Inclusion and Equality
 â€¢ Skills and Talent Development
 â€¢ Environment and Climate Change
jammers.externalDescriptor: We'd love to work together to bring these ideas to life alongside the Scottish Tech Army and really make a difference.
jammers.judgingDescription: Our judges will be considering the following when casting their vote:

criteria.title: Fun & Engaging
criteria.description: We want to prioritise a fun, player-first experience when creating games. Does it convey the core idea well? Does it stand out? Would you play it again and again?

criteria.title: Approachability & Accessibility
criteria.description: Is your game easy to pick up and play? Can anyone play it? Have you taken into consideration different people's needs?

criteria.title: Theme Interpretation & Creativity
criteria.description: There is a challenge to solve, but it's up to you and your team on how you approach it. Does your game fit with the theme? Is your concept unique?

criteria.title: Learning & Adaptability
criteria.description: Whether you're a first-timer or seasoned pro, there's always something new to learn. Did you try out a new skill or go out of your comfort zone? Did your team adapt and improve as the day went on?

criteria.title: Technical Execution & Polish
criteria.description: While the focus is on the process, we still want to showcase technical excellence. Does your game run smoothly? Are there any bugs? Have you solved a tricky technical problem?

Pitches.title: Pitches
Pitches.description: All teams will have the opportunity to give a 5 minute pitch of their game to the judges.
Pitches.time: Pitches will start at 3:20pm in the :
Pitches.presentation: You can use slides, a live demo, or any other format you like to present your game. Be creative and have fun!

prizes.all: A team mystery Geek Crate with 10 - 15 items and :
prizes.External: Game Maker License for each team member.

prizes.all: A team mystery Geek Crate with 10 - 15 items.
A team mystery Geek Crate with 6 - 10 items.

resources.title: Unity Engine
resources.description: A versatile and widely-used game engine suitable for both 2D and 3D games development.

resources.title: Unreal Engine
resources.description: Known for its high-quality graphics and powerful tools, ideal for 3D games.

resources.title: Game Maker Studio
resources.description: Great for 2D game development with a user-friendly interface.

resources.title: Godot
resources.description: An open-source game engine that supports both 2D and 3D game development.

resources.title: Aseprite
resources.description: A pixel art tool for creating 2D sprites and animations.

resources.title: GIMP
resources.description: A free and open-source image editor, similar to Adobe Photoshop.

resources.title: Krita
resources.description: A professional, free and open-source painting program.

resources.title: Blender
resources.description: A free and open-source 3D modelling, sculpting and animation software.

resources.title: Audacity
resources.description: A free, open-source audio editor and recorder.

resources.title: Bfxr
resources.description: A tool for creating sound effects, especially for retro style games.

resources.title: LMMS
resources.description: A free digital audio workstation for music production.

resources.title: Visual Studio Code
resources.description: A popular code editor with support for many programming languages.

resources.title: Sublime Text
resources.description: A sophisticated text editor for code, markup and prose.

resources.title: Github
resources.description: A platform for version control and collaboration on code.

resources.title: Kenney.nl
resources.description: Offers a wide range of free game assets, incuding sprites, audio and 3D models.

resources.title: OpenGameArt
resources.description: A repository of free game art, including sprites, textures and sound effects.

resources.title: Trello
resources.description: A project management tool to help organise tasks and collaborate with team members.

resources.title: Tiled
resources.description: A map editor for creating tile-based levels.

resources.title: Inkscape
resources.description: A free and open-source vector graphics editor.

tutorials.title: Get Started With React By Building A Whac-A-Mole Game
Create a Snake Game in React
How to Build Tetris in React (with React Hooks!)
Introduction to Game Development with Javascript
JavaScript Game Development Course for Beginners
